alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:20PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 445 PM MST... At 420 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported an intense snow shower near Lolo, or 9 miles southwest of Missoula, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside and East Missoula. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 101 and 110. Highway 93 S between mile markers 86 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
